definitions: formal withdrawal or cancellation of a published statement, claim, or promise
action of drawing something back or pulling it inward
medical process where tissue or body part draws back from its normal position
examples: The newspaper issued a retraction of the false story about the senator
His retraction of the allegations came too late to prevent damage
The retraction of the landing gear happens automatically after takeoff
Scientists observed the retraction of the snail into its shell
The surgeon noted abnormal retraction of the chest wall during breathing
Muscle retraction can occur after serious injuries or surgery

definitions: process of learning new skills to update existing professional capabilities
educational program designed to prepare workers for different careers or industries
examples: The company provided retraining on the new software systems
Regular retraining keeps employees current with industry standards
After the factory closed, workers received retraining for healthcare positions
Government-funded retraining programs help displaced workers find new careers

definitions: act of moving back from danger, difficulty, or confrontation
quiet, private place used for rest, meditation, or escape from daily life
organized period of group withdrawal for prayer, meditation, or focused discussion
examples: The army's retreat from the battlefield was orderly and strategic
His retreat from public life followed the scandal
They bought a mountain retreat for weekend getaways
The writer's retreat overlooked a peaceful lake
The church organized a weekend retreat for youth members
She attended a meditation retreat to reduce stress

definitions: past tense form indicating completed action of moving back or withdrawing
examples: The soldiers retreated across the river at dawn
She retreated to her room after the argument

definitions: process of reducing costs or spending in response to economic difficulty
formal reduction in number of employees through systematic layoffs or position eliminations
examples: The company announced retrenchment measures to survive the recession
Budget retrenchment affected all government departments
Mass retrenchment left thousands of workers unemployed
The retrenchment package included severance pay and job placement services

definitions: new trial of a legal case after the original trial was declared invalid or inconclusive
examples: The appeals court ordered a retrial due to jury misconduct
His lawyer successfully argued for a retrial based on new evidence

definitions: punishment inflicted on someone as vengeance for wrong or criminal act
divine punishment believed to be imposed for sin or wrongdoing in religious contexts
examples: The victims' families sought retribution for the crimes committed
Fear of retribution kept witnesses from testifying
Many cultures believe in divine retribution for moral transgressions
The flood was seen as retribution for humanity's wickedness

definitions: act of getting something back from where it was placed or lost
process of accessing and obtaining stored data from computer systems or databases
psychological process of accessing information stored in memory
examples: The retrieval of the sunken treasure took months of planning
Document retrieval from the archive requires special permission
Data retrieval speeds depend on the storage medium used
The system allows quick retrieval of customer information
Memory retrieval becomes more difficult with age
Retrieval cues help students remember learned material

definitions: breed of dog originally trained to retrieve game for hunters
tool or device designed to reach and recover objects from difficult locations
examples: Their golden retriever loves swimming and fetching sticks
Labrador retrievers make excellent family pets and service dogs
The mechanic used a magnetic retriever to get the bolt from the engine
Golf ball retrievers help players collect balls from water hazards

definitions: style, fashion, or design that deliberately imitates trends from the recent past
examples: The diner's retro decor featured chrome fixtures and vinyl booths
She wore a retro dress inspired by 1960s fashion

definitions: addition of new technology or features to older systems, buildings, or equipment
examples: The building retrofit included earthquake-resistant supports and energy-efficient windows
They decided to retrofit the old machinery rather than buy new equipment

definitions: contemplation or review of past events, typically with greater understanding than at the time
examples: In retrospect, quitting that job was the best decision she made
The policy seemed reasonable at the time but failed in retrospect

definitions: exhibition or compilation showcasing an artist's work over their career
formal review or analysis of past events, decisions, or time periods
examples: The museum organized a retrospective of the photographer's fifty-year career
The film retrospective featured all of the director's major works
The team conducted a retrospective analysis of the project's failures
The retrospective study examined patient outcomes over ten years

definitions: act of coming or going back to a place, person, or state
item that has been brought back to a store or sent back to supplier
profit or loss from an investment calculated as percentage of initial amount
examples: Her return to work after maternity leave was smooth
The return journey took longer due to bad weather
The store processes returns within thirty days of purchase
Damaged returns cost retailers billions annually
The investment showed a twelve percent return last year
Tax returns must be filed before the April deadline

definitions: political or social process of bringing together parts that were previously separated or divided
examples: German reunification occurred in 1990 after the fall of the Berlin Wall
Family reunification programs help immigrants bring relatives to their new country

definitions: social gathering of people who have been separated or have not seen each other for some time
examples: The high school reunion attracted classmates from around the world
Their family reunion happens every summer at the lake house

definitions: single complete rotation of an engine measured in revolutions per minute
examples: The engine reached five thousand revs per minute
Keep the revs low when the engine is cold

definitions: process of assessing something again to determine its current worth or importance
official increase in the value of a currency relative to other currencies
examples: Property revaluation occurs every three years for tax purposes
The revaluation of company assets revealed hidden value
The currency revaluation made imports cheaper for consumers
Central banks sometimes force revaluation to control inflation

definitions: act of making known something previously secret or unknown through discovery or disclosure
examples: The revealing of classified documents caused a political scandal
Her revealing of personal struggles inspired many readers

definitions: bugle call or signal used to wake military personnel at sunrise
examples: Reveille sounded at dawn every morning at the base
The troops assembled immediately after reveille

definitions: lively party or celebration involving dancing, drinking, and enjoyment
examples: The street revel continued until the early morning hours
Medieval revels often lasted for several days

definitions: surprising and previously unknown fact that has been disclosed to others
divine truth or knowledge believed to be communicated by God to humans
examples: The revelation that he had been lying shocked everyone
Recent revelations about the company's practices led to investigations
The Book of Revelation contains prophetic visions
Many religions are based on divine revelation to prophets

definitions: lively, noisy festivities that involve drinking, dancing, and merrymaking
examples: The New Year's revelry lasted until sunrise
Campus revelry often disturbs nearby residents

definitions: action of inflicting hurt or harm on someone for injury or wrong suffered
examples: He sought revenge against those who had betrayed him
The movie's plot centered on a woman's revenge against her attackers

definitions: income that a government, company, or organization receives from normal business operations
examples: The company's revenue increased by twenty percent last quarter
Tax revenue funds government programs and services

definitions: prolongation of sound by reflection from surfaces causing echo effect
continuing and serious indirect effect or influence of an action or event
examples: The reverberation in the empty hall made speech difficult to understand
Sound engineers minimize reverberation in recording studios
The reverberations of the financial crisis lasted for years
Political reverberations from the scandal continued through the election

definitions: feeling of deep respect tinged with awe typically for someone or something
examples: His revere for the elderly teacher was evident
The community's revere for tradition shapes local customs

definitions: deep respect and admiration felt for someone or something
gesture or act showing deep respect such as a bow or curtsy
examples: She spoke of her mentor with great reverence
The ancient texts are treated with reverence by scholars
He made a reverence before approaching the altar
The knight's reverence to the queen was gracefully executed

definitions: title given to members of the clergy, especially Protestant ministers
examples: Reverend Johnson delivered an inspiring sermon on Sunday
The reverend visited sick members of the congregation weekly

definitions: state of being pleasantly lost in one's thoughts or daydream
examples: She fell into a reverie while watching the sunset
His reverie was interrupted by a knock at the door

definitions: change to an opposite direction, position, or course of action
annulment of a judgment, sentence, or decree by a higher court
examples: The reversal of company policy surprised employees
His reversal of fortune came after winning the lottery
The appeals court ordered a reversal of the conviction
The reversal of the lower court's decision set new precedent

definitions: back or opposite side of something, especially of a coin or medal
opposite direction to normal forward movement, particularly in vehicles
complete change to opposite of what existed or was expected
examples: The reverse of the coin shows an eagle
Instructions are printed on the reverse of the package
Put the car in reverse to back out of the garage
The reverse gear makes a different sound
The election results were the reverse of predictions
We experienced the reverse of what we hoped for

definitions: piece of clothing that can be worn with either side facing outward
examples: Her reversible jacket was red on one side and blue on the other
Reversible belts offer two color options in one accessory

definitions: return to a previous state, practice, or belief after temporary change
legal return of property to original owner when conditions are met
examples: The patient's reversion to childhood behavior concerned the psychiatrist
The software's reversion to default settings fixed the problem
Upon his death, reversion of the estate goes to his children
The lease includes a reversion clause after twenty years

definitions: process of going back to a previous state, practice, or condition
examples: Reverting to old habits proved difficult to avoid
The system keeps reverting to the previous version

definitions: critical assessment of a book, play, movie, or other work
formal assessment or examination of something with intention to institute change
process of going over previously studied material to refresh memory
examples: The movie received mixed reviews from critics
She writes book reviews for the local newspaper
The annual review of company policies begins next month
The board will review all budget proposals
Final exam review sessions help students prepare
A quick review of notes before class helps retention

definitions: person who writes critical assessments of books, performances, or products
examples: The restaurant reviewer gave the new bistro four stars
Product reviewers tested the device for six months

definitions: process of examining and making corrections or improvements to written work
examples: Students must revise their essays before final submission
The author will revise the manuscript based on editor feedback

definitions: ongoing process of reviewing and improving written work or plans
examples: Revising the proposal took longer than writing it
She spent hours revising her thesis chapters

definitions: piece of written work that has been corrected, improved, or updated
process of reviewing material previously studied, especially for examinations
examples: The third revision of the textbook includes new chapters
Submit your revision by Friday afternoon
Exam revision should begin weeks before the test
Her revision notes were color-coded by topic

definitions: practice of reinterpreting historical events, often challenging orthodox or accepted views
examples: Historical revisionism sometimes reveals overlooked perspectives
Critics accused him of dangerous revisionism regarding war crimes

definitions: person who advocates revision of accepted historical accounts or political doctrines
examples: Revisionist historians challenge traditional narratives about the Civil War
The revisionist approach offers alternative interpretations of events

definitions: process of giving new life, energy, or vigor to something that was declining
examples: Urban revitalisation transformed the abandoned district
The revitalisation programme brought new businesses downtown

definitions: process of giving new life, energy, or vigor to something that was declining
examples: Downtown revitalization attracted young professionals to the area
Economic revitalization requires investment in infrastructure

definitions: renewal of interest in or popularity of something from the past
reawakening of religious fervor, especially through evangelistic meetings
new production of an old play or similar theatrical work
examples: The revival of vinyl records surprised the music industry
Fashion revivals often bring back styles from previous decades
The religious revival drew thousands to tent meetings
Spiritual revival transformed the community's values
Broadway's revival of the classic musical won several awards
The Shakespeare revival featured modern costumes

definitions: organized religious movement seeking to reawaken faith through emotional meetings and conversions
examples: Nineteenth-century revivalism shaped American religious culture
Revivalism emphasized personal conversion experiences

definitions: preacher who conducts religious revivals seeking to inspire renewed faith
examples: The revivalist traveled from town to town holding meetings
Famous revivalists drew crowds of thousands to their sermons

definitions: official cancellation or withdrawal of a license, right, or agreement
examples: License revocation followed multiple traffic violations
The revocation of his security clearance ended his career

definitions: act of officially canceling or withdrawing a decree, decision, or promise
examples: The court can revoke bail if conditions are violated
They threatened to revoke his membership privileges

definitions: violent attempt to overthrow authority or government control
strong feeling of disgust or disapproval leading to rejection
examples: The peasant revolt lasted three months before being suppressed
Student revolt against university policies led to reforms
Consumer revolt against high prices forced companies to reconsider
Her revolt against family traditions caused tension
